div1.note: The preceding text is in two columns, whereas this one, beginning halfway down the page is in one column. It is numbered 3, and the layout will presumably be handled in the facsimile markup. Also, the lines are written with line breaks after each ab couplet and punctus elevatus between the a-verse and the b-verse. Right now, I have simply added @rend="halfline" to div1, but extra markup will have to indicate where line breaks will have to be inserted in the views.

lg.l: ls Als i la&ydot; in a winteri&slong; n&ydot;t&punctelev;
in a d&rrot;oukeni&combmacr;g droukening bifo&rrot; þe da&ydot;
vo&rrot; &slong;oþe i &slong;auȝ a &slong;ell&ydot; s&ydot;t&punctelev;
a bod&ydot; on a bere la&ydot;
Þat hauede ben a mod&ydot; kn&ydot;ȝt&punctelev;
and lutel serued god God to pa&ydot;ȝ
Lo&rrot;en he haued þe liues l&ydot;ȝt&punctelev;

þe go&slong;t was oute and &slong;cholde awa&ydot; In the first stanza the b-rhymes are connected by wavy lines in brown ink (possibly by a later hand). This was presumably to clarify the rhyme scheme.
wan þe gost it scholde go&punctelev;
&ydot;t biwente and with&slong;tod
so &slong;erfulli with d&rrot;edli Mod mod
It &slong;eide weile and walawo&punctelev;
wo wo&rrot;þe þi fle&ydot;s þi foule blod
wreche bodi wȝ&ydot; listouȝ so&punctelev;
þat ȝwilene were &slong;o wilde and wod The page appears to have been marked with the double solidus for the rubricator to add pilcrows later. These are indicated in anonymous blocks.
Þow þat were woned to ride&punctelev;
he&ydot;ȝe on ho&rrot;&slong;e in and out
So kowe&ydot;nte knit Ikud ikud &slong;o wide&punctelev;
as a l&ydot;un fers and p&rrot;oud
Ȝwere is al þi Michele michele p&rrot;ide&punctelev;
and þi lede þat was &slong;o loud
Ȝwi listou here &slong;o bare&slong;ide&punctelev;
Ip&rrot;icked ipricked in þat po&rrot;e sch&rrot;oud
Ȝwere beon þi ca&slong;tles and þi toure&slong;&punctelev;
þi chaumb&rrot;e&slong; and þi riche halles
Ipe&ydot;nted with &slong;o riche floures&punctelev;
and þi riche robe&slong; alle
Þine cowlte&slong; and þi couertoure&slong;
þi cendel&slong; and þi riche palles
Wrechede it is nouȝ þi bour&punctelev;
toMoruwe tomoruwe þouȝ schalt þerinne falle
Ȝwere ben þi Murdli wurdli wede&slong;&punctelev;
þi &slong;omer&slong; with þi riche bedde&slong;
Þi p&rrot;oude palefre&ydot;&slong; and þi &slong;tede&slong;&punctelev;
þat þouȝ hadde&slong;t in de&slong;ter ledde&slong;
Þi faucoun&slong; þat were wont to grede&punctelev;
and þine hounde&slong; þat þou ledde
Meþinkeþ god God is þe to gnede&punctelev;
þat alle þine frend beon fro þe fledde
Ȝwere ben þine cokes &slong;nelle&punctelev;
þat &slong;cholden gon greiþe þi Mete mete
With spece&slong; swete for to smelle&punctelev;
þat þouȝ neuere werere were fol of frete
To do þat foule fle&ydot;&slong; to suwelle&punctelev;
þat foule wo&rrot;me&slong; scholden ete
And þouȝ haue&slong;t þe pine of helle&punctelev;
with gloton&ydot;e me bigete
For god God &slong;chop þe aftir his &slong;chap&punctelev;
and gaf þe boþe w&ydot;t and &slong;kil
In þi loking wa&slong; ilaft&punctelev;
to wi&slong;&slong;e aftir þin oune wil
Ne toc i nevere w&ydot;checraft&punctelev;
ne wi&slong;t i ȝwat wa&slong; guod no&rrot; il
Bute as a wretche dumb and mad&punctelev;

bote a&slong; touȝ tauȝte&slong;t
me þertil
Set to &slong;eruen þe to queme&punctelev;
boþe at even and amo&rrot;uen
Siþin i was þe bitauȝt to ȝeme&punctelev;
fro þe time þat þouȝ was bo&rrot;n
Þouȝ þat dede&slong; couþe&slong;t deme&punctelev;
&slong;cholde&slong;t habbe be war bifo&rrot;n
Of mi fol&ydot;e a&slong; it semet&punctelev;
nouȝ wiþ þiselue thouȝ art fo&rrot;lo&rrot;n
Þe ga&slong;t it se&ydot;de bodi be &slong;tille&punctelev;
ȝwo haþ lered þe al þis wite
Þat giue&slong;t me þe&slong;e wo&rrot;de&slong; grille&punctelev;
þat li&slong;t þer bollen a&slong; a bite
Wene&slong;touȝ wretche þor þouȝ fille&punctelev;
wid þi foule fleich&slong; apite
Of alle dedes thouȝ dide&slong;t ille&punctelev;
þat þouȝ &slong;o litel &slong;chalt be quite
Wene&slong;tou nou gete þe griþ&punctelev;
þer þouȝ li&slong;t roten in þe cla&ydot;
Þe&ydot; þouȝ be rotin pile and pid&punctelev;
and blowen wiþ þe wind awa&ydot;
Ȝeot &slong;chaltouȝ come wiþ lime and l&ydot;þ&punctelev;
agein to me on dome&slong;da&ydot;
And come to court and i þe wiþ&punctelev;

fo&rrot; to kepen oure ha&rrot;de payHorstmann reads "ha" for the slightly ill-formed first two letters of "harde", but the word may also be read as "borde", which is perhaps likelier since the vowel is followed by a round r.
To teche ȝwere þouȝ me bitauȝt&punctelev;
ac ȝwan þouȝ þouȝte&slong;t of the qued
Wiþ þi teþ þe b&rrot;idel þouȝ lauȝt&punctelev;
þouȝ di&slong;t al þat i þe fo&rrot;bed
To &slong;unne and &slong;chame it was þi d&rrot;auȝt&punctelev;
til vntid and til wikkedehed
Inouȝ i &slong;tod age&ydot;n and fauȝt&punctelev;
bot ai þouȝ nome þin oune red
Wan i þe wolde teme and teche&punctelev;

++
ȝwat was uuel and ȝwat was guod
Of cri&slong;t Crist ne kirke was no &slong;peche&punctelev;
bote renne aboute and b&rrot;e&ydot;d wod
Inouȝ i miȝte p&rrot;e&ydot;e and p&rrot;eche&punctelev;
ne miȝte i nevere wende þi mod
Þat þouȝ wolde&slong;t god God knouleche

but don al þat þin herte
to &slong;tod
I bad þe þenke on soulenede&punctelev;
Þouȝ mo&slong;ti&slong;t fir&slong;t don oþere dede&punctelev;
þou &slong;eidi&slong;t al was Idel idel idel gong
To wode and water and feld þouȝ ede&slong;t&punctelev;
o&rrot; to cour court to do men wrong
Bote fo&rrot; p&rrot;ide o&rrot; gretto&rrot;e mede&punctelev;
lutel þouȝ du&slong;t guod among
Nouȝ mouwe be wilde be&slong;tes renne&punctelev;
and lien vnder linde and lef
And foule&slong; flie bi feld and fenne&punctelev;
siþin þi fal&slong;e herte clef
Þine eiȝene are blinde and connen nouȝt kenne&punctelev;

þi mouth is du&combtilde;b dumb ·þin ere is def A vertical ink stroke follows "def". It may only be a stray mark, but it ma&ydot; also be evidence of the scribe's attempt to ascertain the rhyme scheme.
And nouȝ &slong;o lodl&ydot; þouȝ li&slong;t grenne&punctelev;
fro þe comeþ a wikke wef
Ne ni&slong; no leuedi b&rrot;iȝt on ble&punctelev;
þat wel weren Iwoned iwoned of þe to lete
Þat wolde l&ydot;e aniȝth bi þe&punctelev;
fo&rrot; nouȝth but men miȝte hem bihete
Þouȝ art vnseml&ydot; fo&rrot; to &slong;e&punctelev;
vncomli fo&rrot;to cu&slong;&slong;en &slong;uwete
Þouȝ ne haue&slong;t frend þat ne wolde fle&punctelev;
Come þouȝ &slong;tertlinde i&combtilde; in þe &slong;trete
Þe bodi it &slong;eide ic &slong;e&ydot;ȝe&punctelev;
ga&slong;t þouȝ ha&slong;t wrong iw&ydot;s
Al þe w&ydot;t on me to le&ydot;e&punctelev;
þat þouȝ ha&slong;t lo&rrot;n þi mikil blis
Were wa&slong; i bi wode o&rrot; we&ydot;ȝe&punctelev;
sat o&rrot; &slong;tud o&rrot; dide ouȝt M&ydot;s m&ydot;s
Þat i ne wa&slong; a&ydot; vnder þin e&ydot;ȝe&punctelev;
wel þouȝ wo&slong;t þat soth it &ydot;s
þat i ne bar þe on m&ydot; bac
Als þin as fro toun to toun&punctelev;
als &slong;e þouȝ me lete have rap and rac
Þat tou ne were and red roun&punctelev;
neuere did i þing ne &slong;pac
Here þe &slong;oþe &slong;e men Mouen mouen &punctelev;
on me þat ligge here &slong;o blo and blac
Fo&rrot; al be wile þouȝ were mi fere&punctelev;
I hadde al þat me was ned
I miȝte &slong;peke se and here&punctelev;
I ede and rod and d&rrot;ank and et
Lodli chaunched is m&ydot; chere&punctelev;
sin þe t&ydot;me þat þouȝ me let
Def and dumb i ligge on bere&punctelev;
þat i ne ma&ydot; &slong;terin hand ne fet
I &slong;cholde have ben dumb as a schep&punctelev;
or as is nouwe o&rrot; as a su&ydot;n
Þat et and d&rrot;ank and lei adn and and slep&punctelev;
sla&ydot;n and pa&slong;&slong;id al his pin
Neuere of catel he ne kep&punctelev;
ne w&ydot;&slong;te wat was water ne w&ydot;n
Ne le&ydot;n in helle þat is &slong;o dep&punctelev;
neuere ne wi&slong;t i of al þat al was tin
Þe ga&slong;t &ydot;t &slong;eide is no doute&punctelev;
abouten bodi þouȝ me bar
Þou mo&slong;ti&slong;t nede i was wiþoute&punctelev;
hand and fot i was wel war
Bute as tou bere me aboute&punctelev;
ne miȝt i do be le&slong;te char
Þo&rrot;fo&rrot;e mo&slong;t i nede loute&punctelev;
so doth þat non oþer dar
Of o w&ydot;mman bo&rrot;n and b&rrot;edde&punctelev;The initial "O" resembles a capital "M", which may be a slip or an indication that the scribe began writing something else.
bod&ydot; were we boþe tvo
Togid&rrot;e fo&slong;trid fa&ydot;re and fedde&punctelev;
til þou couþi&slong;t &slong;speke and go
Softe þe fo&rrot; loue i ledde&punctelev;
ne do&rrot;&slong;t i neuere do þe wo
To le&slong;e þe so &slong;o&rrot;e i d&rrot;edde&punctelev;
and wel i wi&slong;te to getin namo
Fo&rrot; me þou wolde&slong;t &slong;umwat do&punctelev;
wȝile þou were ȝong a litil fir&slong;t
Fo&rrot; frende&slong; e&ydot;ȝe þat þe &slong;tod to&punctelev;
þe wile þou were betin and bir&slong;t
Oc wan þouȝ were þriuen and þro&punctelev;
and knewe honger cold and uir&slong;tRead "þirst"?
And ȝhwilk was e&ydot;&slong;e re&slong;t and ro&punctelev;
al þin oune wil þou di&slong;t
I sau þe fair on fle&ydot;ch&slong; and blod&punctelev;
and al mi loue on þe i ke&slong;t
Þat þou þrive me þouȝte guod&punctelev;
And let þe hauen ro and re&slong;t
Þat made þe &slong;o &slong;turne of mod&punctelev;
and of werke&slong; so vnwre&slong;t
To fiȝte with þe ne was no bot&punctelev;
Me me þat þouȝ bar in þi b&rrot;e&slong;t
p&rrot;ude and wicke coue&ydot;ti&slong;e
Niþe and onde and enuie&punctelev;
to god God of heuene and alle hi&slong;e
And in vnlu&slong;t fo&rrot;to l&ydot;e&punctelev;
wa&slong; te wane in al þi&slong;eThe first letter looks like "þise", as Garner reads. However, Linow interprets the word as "wise". The initial letter could be a remnant of a wynn in an exemplar.
That i &slong;chal nouȝ ful dere ab&ydot;e&punctelev;
A we&ydot;le &slong;o&rrot;e ma&ydot; me gri&slong;e
Þou wa&slong; warned her bifo&rrot;e&punctelev;

ȝwat
we boþe &slong;cholden haueThe deleted "we" in the next line suggest that the word was in the scribe's exemplar.
Idel tale held tou þat þo&rrot;e&punctelev;
Þoȝ þou &slong;auȝ fele bi dun in graue
Þou di&slong;t al þat þe werld þe bad&punctelev;The space is possibly; an erasure which was not overwritten, but no text is detectable now.
and þat þi fle&ydot;s þe wolde craue
to be mai&slong;ter and i þi cnaue
Iwene&slong;te þouȝ go&slong;t þe ge&ydot;ned out&punctelev;
fo&rrot;to quite þe wiþ al
Þouȝ þat was &slong;o wo&rrot;dl&ydot; wrouȝt&punctelev;
to &slong;e&ydot;e i made þe m&ydot; þ&rrot;al
Dud i neuere on liue nouȝt&punctelev;
I ne rafte ne i ne &slong;tal
Þat fur&slong;t of þe ne kam þe þouȝt&punctelev;
Ab&ydot; &ydot;t þat ab&ydot;ȝe schal
Ȝwat wi&slong;t i wat wa&slong; wrong&punctelev; o&rrot; rith The scribe misplaces the punctus elevatus after "wrong". Given the rhyme scheme, the line correctly ends after "or rith".
wWat to take o&rrot; ȝwat to schone
Bote þat þouȝ potti&slong;t in mi &slong;iȝth&punctelev;
þat al þe wi&slong;dom scholde&slong;t cone
Ȝwanne þouȝ me tauȝti&slong;t on vntiȝth&punctelev;
An an me gan þeroffe mone
Þanne dud i al m&ydot; miȝth&punctelev;
Anoþer anoþer time to have m&ydot; wone
Oc haddi&slong;t þouȝ þat cri&slong;t Crist it ovþe&punctelev;
giuen me hunger uur&slong;t and cold
And þouȝ wite&slong;t me þat no guod couþe&punctelev;
In bismere ȝwan i was &slong;o bold
Þat i hadde vndernomen in ȝouþe
I hauede holden old
Þou let me rek&ydot;n no&rrot;th and &slong;outh&punctelev;
and hauen al m&ydot; wille on wold
ne fo&rrot; non oþer wo&rrot;ldes winne
Haue &slong;offrid me to lein on hond&punctelev;
þat hauede to&rrot;nd to &slong;chame o&rrot; &slong;unne
Oc fo&rrot; i be &slong;o ei&slong;e fond&punctelev;
And and þi wretche wit so þunne
Þat a&ydot; was wriþinde as a wond&punctelev;
þefo&rrot;e þerfo&rrot;e couþe i neuere blinne
To &slong;unne þouȝ wi&slong;ti&slong;t was m&ydot; kinde&punctelev;
as Mankinne mankinne it is also
And to þe wretche wo&rrot;ld so Minde minde
and to þe fend that is o&rrot;e fo
Þouȝ &slong;cholde&slong;t er haue late me binde&punctelev;
wan i mi&slong;dede and don me wo
Ac ȝwanne þe blinde lat þe blinde&punctelev;
In in dike he fallen boþe two
Þo bigan þe go&slong;t to wepe&punctelev;
An and &slong;eide bodi allas allas
Þat i þe louede euere ȝete
fo&rrot; al mi loue on þe i las
Þat tou louede&slong;t me þouȝ le lete &punctelev;
and made&slong;t me an houue of glas
I dide al þat þe was sete&punctelev;
and þouȝ m&ydot; tra&ydot;to&rrot; euere was
ho ma&ydot; mo&rrot;E tra&ydot;&slong;on do&punctelev;
o&rrot; is louerd betere engine
þan he þat al is tri&slong;t i&slong; to&punctelev;
In and ouȝt a&slong; ovne h&ydot;n
a&ydot; &slong;eþþe þouȝ was þ&rrot;iuen and þ&rrot;o&punctelev;
Mitti&slong; mittis dedi alle Mine mine
To po&rrot;ueȝe þe re&slong; and ro&punctelev;
And and þouȝ to b&rrot;inge me in pine
Þe fend of helle þat haueþ enuiȝe&punctelev;
To mankune and euere haþ had
Wa&slong; in v&slong; a&slong; a &slong;pie&punctelev;
To do &slong;um god ȝwan i þe bad
Þe werld he toc to cumpa&ydot;niȝe&punctelev;
þat mani a &slong;oule haued fo&rrot;rad
Þe&ydot; þ&rrot;e wi&slong;ten þi fol&ydot;e&punctelev;
And and madin wretche þe al mad
Ȝwan i bad þe re&slong;te take&punctelev;
fo&rrot;&slong;ake &slong;unne a&ydot; and oo
þe fe fend &slong;eide þouȝ schalt nouȝt so
Þo&slong; &slong;one al þi bli&slong;&slong;e fo&rrot;&slong;ake&punctelev;
To liuen a&ydot; in pine and wo
Io&ydot;ȝe and bli&slong;&slong;e i rede þouȝ make&punctelev;
And þenke to liue ȝeres mo
Ȝwan i bad te leue p&rrot;ide
Þi manie Mes mes þi riche sch&rrot;oud
Þe fal&slong;e wo&rrot;ld þat &slong;tod bide&slong;ide&punctelev;
bad þe be ful quo&ydot;nte and p&rrot;oud
Þi fle&ydot;ch&slong; with riche robes sch&rrot;ide&punctelev;
Nouȝt nouȝt al&slong; a beggare in a clouȝt
And on heiȝe ho&rrot;&slong;e to ride&punctelev;
with mikel me&ydot;ne in and ouȝt
Ȝwan i bad þe erliche to ri&slong;e&punctelev;
nim of me þi &slong;oule kep
fo&rrot;gon þe murie mo&rrot;we slep
Wȝau Wȝan ȝe hadden &slong;et &ydot;our &slong;i&slong;e&punctelev;

þe Ȝe þre tra&ydot;tour&slong; &slong;o&rrot;e i wep Linow's emendation is supported by; the following line, which appears to begin with "ye", rather than "þe". However, that would suggest that the emendation in this line should also be to "ye". Both lines are characterised by larger, less precise, ductus.
As þe boþelere doþ is schep
togidere weren agein me swo&rrot;n

Al þe ȝe maden troteuale&punctelev; At this point the scribe is starting to use thorn for yogh, which Linow silentl&ydot; corrects. The thorn may be an undotted "y", in which case it should be represented as an undotted y and no correction should be made. The text will have to be checked carefully for examples of this phenomenon.
þat ihaued &slong;eid bifo&rrot;n
Ȝe ledde me bi doune and dale&punctelev;
As a noxe an oxe bi þe ho&rrot;n
þer his þ&rrot;ote schal be scho&rrot;n
Fo&rrot; loue þi wille i folewede al&punctelev;
And to min oune deth i d&rrot;ouȝ
To foluwe þe þat was mi þ&rrot;al&punctelev;
þat euere were fal&slong;e and frouȝ
Þouȝ it di&slong;t and i fo&rrot;hal
we wi&slong;tin wel it was wouȝ
Þerfo&rrot;e mote we keþe o&rrot;e fal&punctelev;
pine and schame and &slong;o&rrot;ewe inouȝ
Þeiȝ alle þe men nouȝ vnder mone&punctelev;
to demen weren &slong;ete on benche
ne &slong;chuldin haluendel biþenke
Ne helpeþ vs no bede ne bone&punctelev;
ne ma&ydot; v&slong; nou no w&ydot;l towrenche
Hellehounde&slong; cometh nou &slong;one&punctelev;
fo&rrot;bi Fo&rrot;þi ne mouwe we no&ydot;þer blenche
Ȝwan þat bodi &slong;a&ydot; þat go&slong;t&punctelev;
þat Mone mone and al þat &slong;o&rrot;uwe make
It &slong;e&ydot;de allas þat m&ydot; lif hath la&slong;t&punctelev;
Þat i haue liued fo&rrot;&slong;unne &slong;ake
Min herte þat anon ne hadde tobo&rrot;&slong;te&punctelev;
ȝwan i was fram mi Moder moder take

I
Miȝte miȝte have ben in erþe ke&slong;t&punctelev;
And ileiȝen and iroted in a lake
Þanne haued i neuere lerned&punctelev;
ȝwat wa&slong; vuel ne ȝwat was guod
Ne no þing with wrong ȝernd&punctelev;
ne pine þoled as i Mot mot
Ȝwere no &slong;eint miȝte beren o&rrot;e ernde&punctelev;
to him þat bouȝte v&slong; with is blod
In helle hwanne we ben b&rrot;end&punctelev;
of &slong;um merci to don v&slong; bot
Na&ydot; bodi nouȝ i&slong; to late&punctelev;
o&rrot;to p&rrot;eiȝe and to p&rrot;eche
Nou þe wa&ydot;n i&slong; ate ȝate&punctelev;
And þi tonge haþ leid þe &slong;peche
O po&ydot;nt of o&rrot;e pine to bate&punctelev;
In þe wo&rrot;ld ne is no leche
Al tegidere we gon o gate&punctelev;
swilk is gode&slong; Godes harde wreche
Ac hadde&slong;t þouȝ a lutel er&punctelev;
ȝwile v&slong; was lif togid&rrot;e lent
Þo þat was &slong;o &slong; ek and ser&punctelev;
v&slong; &slong;ch&rrot;iuen and þe deuel schent
And laten renne a reul&ydot; ter&punctelev;
and bihiȝt amendement
Ne þo&rrot;te v&slong; haue friȝt ne fer&punctelev;
þat god God ne wolde his bli&slong;&slong;e v&slong; &slong;ent
Þe&ydot; alle þe men þat ben o l&ydot;ue&slong;
weren p&rrot;e&slong;tes me&slong;&slong;es to &slong;inge
And alle þe maidene&slong; and þe w&ydot;ues&punctelev;
w&ydot;dewes hondene fo&rrot;to wringe
And Miȝte miȝte suweche f&ydot;ue&punctelev;
als is in werld of alle þinge

Siþin we ne Mouwen mouwen
n v&slong; suluen sch&rrot;iue&punctelev;
Ne schulde v&slong; into bli&slong;&slong;e b&rrot;inge
Bodi i ma&ydot; no mo&rrot;e duelle&punctelev;
ne &slong;tonde fo&rrot;to &slong;peke with þe
Hellehounde&slong; here i ȝelle&punctelev;
And fendes Mo mo þan men mowe se
Þat comen to fette me to helle&punctelev;
ne ma&ydot; i noweder from hem fle
And þouȝ schalt comen with fle&ydot;s and felle&punctelev;
A dome&slong;da&ydot; to wonie with me
Ne hauede it non er þe wo&rrot;d i&slong;e&ydot;d&punctelev;
þat wi&slong;te ȝwider it &slong;cholde go
In a b&rrot;eken at a b&rrot;eid&punctelev;
A þou&slong;end deuelene and ȝet Mo mo
Ȝwan thei haddin on him le&ydot;d&punctelev;
here &slong;charpe cloches alle þo
Yt was in a so&rrot;i ple&ydot;t&punctelev;
Reuliche to&ydot;led to and fro
Fo&rrot; þei weren ragged rone and ta&ydot;led&punctelev;
with b&rrot;ode bulches on here bac
Scharpe clauwes longe na&ydot;led
no ne was no lime withoute lac
On alleȝ halue it was a&slong;a&ydot;led
With mani a deuel foul and blac
Merci crie&combtilde;de criende lutel auailede&punctelev;
ȝwan cri&slong;t Crist it wolde &slong;o harde wrac
Some þe chaule&slong; it towra&slong;ten&punctelev;
And ȝoten in þe led al hot
And bedin him to d&rrot;inke fa&slong;te&punctelev;
And &slong;enke abonuten him ab&rrot;od
A deuil kam þer ate la&slong;te&punctelev;
þat was mai&slong;ter wel i wot
A colter glowende in him he þ&rrot;a&slong;te&punctelev;
þat it þoo&rrot;uȝ þe herte it smot
Gle&ydot;ues glowende &slong;ome &slong;etten&punctelev;
To bac a and b&rrot;e&slong;t and boþe &slong;ide&slong;
Þat in his herte þe po&ydot;nte&slong; mettin&punctelev;

And #| #
maden him þo wounde&slong; wide
And &slong;eiden him fol wel he lette&punctelev;
þe herte þat was &slong;o fol of p&rrot;ide
Wel he it hadde þat men him bihette&punctelev;
fo&rrot; mo&rrot;e &slong;cholde it bitide
Wo&rrot;dl&ydot; wedes fo&rrot;to were&punctelev;
þei &slong;eiden þat he louede be&slong;t
A deuele&slong; cope fo&rrot;to bere&punctelev;
Al b&rrot;enn&ydot;nde on him wa&slong; ke&slong;t
With hote ha&slong;pes imad to &slong;pere&punctelev;
þat &slong;treite &slong;at to bac and b&rrot;e&slong;t
An helm þat was lutel to here&punctelev;
anon him kam an ho&rrot;s al p&rrot;e&slong;t
Fo&rrot;th was b&rrot;ouȝt þere with a b&rrot;idel&punctelev;
A co&rrot;sed deuel als a cote
Þat gri&slong;liche grennede and ȝenede wide&punctelev;
þe le&ydot;ȝe it lemede of his þ&rrot;ote
With a &slong;adel to the mid &slong;ide&punctelev;
fol of scharpe pike&slong; schote
Alse an hechele onne to ride&punctelev;
Al wa&slong; glowende ilke a grote
Opon þat sadil he wa&slong; sloungen&punctelev;
as he &slong;cholde to þe to&rrot;nement
An hund&rrot;ed deuel on him dongen&punctelev;
her and þer þan he was hent
With hote &slong;pere&slong; þo&rrot;uȝ was &slong;tongen&punctelev;
And houle&slong; wiþ oule&slong; al to&rrot;ent
At ilke a dint þe &slong;parkle&slong; &slong;p&rrot;ongen&punctelev;
A&slong; of a b&rrot;ond þat were fo&rrot;b&rrot;end
Ȝwan he hadde riden þat rode&punctelev;
opon þe &slong;adil þer he was &slong;et
He was ka&slong;t doun as a tode&punctelev;
And hellehounde&slong; to him were led
Þat b&rrot;oiden out þo peces b&rrot;ode&punctelev;
Al&slong; he to helleward was fet
Ther alle þe fende&slong; fet it trode&punctelev;
Men miȝte of blod foluwe þe tred
He beden him hontin and blowen&punctelev;
Crien crien on Bau&slong;ton and Bewi&slong;
Þe ratche&slong; þat him were woned te knowen&punctelev;
he scholden &slong;one blowe þe p&rrot;is
An hund&rrot;ed deuele&slong; ratche&slong; on a rowe&punctelev;
with &slong;tringe&slong; him d&rrot;owen vnþanc his
Til he kome to þat lodli lowe&punctelev;
þer helle was i wot to wi&slong;
Wȝan it kam to þat wikke won&punctelev;
þe fendes ka&slong;ten suwilk a ȝel
Þe erþe it openede anon&punctelev;
smoke and smoþer op it wal
Boþe pich and b&rrot;um&slong;ton&punctelev;
Men m&ydot;ȝte fif mile haue þe smel
Louerd wo schal him be bigon&punctelev;
þat haþ þeroffe be tenþe del
Wȝan þe go&slong;t þe &slong;oþe i&slong;e&ydot;&punctelev;
wȝide it scholde it ka&slong;te a cri
on me þi schap nouȝ haue Merci merci
Ne schope þouȝ me þat art &slong;o sl&ydot;ȝ&punctelev;
þi creature also was I
Als man þat sitte&slong; þe so n&ydot;&punctelev;
þat þou haue&slong;t &slong;o wel don b&ydot;
Þouȝ þat wi&slong;te&slong;t al bifo&rrot;
wȝi schope þou me to wroþer hele
To be þu&slong; togged and toto&rrot;en&punctelev;
And oþere to hauen al mi wele
Þo þat scholden be fo&rrot;lo&rrot;n&punctelev;
wretche&slong; þat tou miȝte&slong;t spele
A weile wȝi le&slong;touȝ hem be bo&rrot;n&punctelev;
to ȝeue þe foule fend &slong;o fele
Agein him þe fende&slong; gonnen criȝe&punctelev;
Caitif helpeþ þe namo&rrot;e
To calle on ihe&slong;us Ihesus ne Marie&punctelev;
Ne to crie cri&slong;te&slong; Cristes o&rrot;e
Lo&rrot;en þouȝ haue&slong;t the cumpain&ydot;e&punctelev;
þou haue&slong;t serued vs so ȝo&rrot;e
Þarfo&rrot;e nou þou schalt ab&ydot;e&punctelev;
as oþere þat leuen on oure lo&rrot;e
Þe foule fende&slong; þat weren fa&ydot;n&punctelev;
bi top and tail he slongen hit
And ke&slong;ten it with m&ydot;ȝt and ma&ydot;n&punctelev;
doun into the deuele&slong; pit
Þer &slong;onne ne schal neuere be &slong;e&ydot;n&punctelev;
hemself he &slong;onken in þermit
Þe erþe hemsulf it lek aȝe&ydot;n&punctelev;
anon þe donge it was fo&rrot;dit

p.hi: Sou ke parla cel&ydot; ki ce&slong;te aui&slong;ion aueit weu e dit i&slong;&slong;i·

lg.l: Wȝan it was fo&rrot;th þat foule lod&punctelev;
to helle wel o&rrot; it were da&ydot;
Ou ilk a her a d&rrot;ope &slong;tod&punctelev;
fo&rrot; friȝt and fer þe&rrot; as i la&ydot;

To ih&combtilde;u Ihesu
cri&slong;t Crist with mild mod&punctelev;
ȝerne i kalde and lokede a&ydot;
Ȝwan þo fende&slong; hot fot
come to fette me awa&ydot;
I þonke him þat þolede deth&punctelev;
his muchele merci and his o&rrot;e
Þat schilde me fram mani a qued&punctelev;
A &slong;unful man as i lai þo&rrot;e
Þo þat &slong;unfol ben i rede hem red&punctelev;
to sr sch&rrot;iuen hem and rewen &slong;o&rrot;e
Neuere was &slong;unne idon &slong;o gret&punctelev;
þat cri&slong;te&slong; Cristes merci ne is wel mo&rrot;e

l.hi:
Sa grace l&ydot; doine ih&combtilde;u Ihesu
cri&slong;t Crist

lg.l: ki ce dite de mein&slong; e&slong;crit
De li seruer de quer parfit&punctelev;
